## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've got a question about creating token currencies. How do I create a token currency on a system that's not based on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, with Verus, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. This is possible because Verus enables users to create decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without requiring any programming knowledge. So, you don't need to be on a Verus-based system to create a token currency. Would you like to know more about creating tokens or blockchains on Verus?

**User:**
That's interesting. I've also heard about DeFi liquidity pools on Verus. Do Verus DeFi liquidity pools require a minimum of 100% asset backing?

**AI Assistant:**
No, Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies can be defined with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100%. This means that the backing can be partial, not necessarily requiring 100% asset backing. This flexibility allows for more creative and flexible DeFi solutions on the Verus platform. Do you have any more questions about DeFi on Verus?

**User:**
One more question, is it possible to launch a blockchain alone, without a liquidity pool, using Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
No, with Verus, the launch of a new blockchain is accompanied by a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool as part of defining the new blockchain. This means that the launch of a blockchain and a liquidity pool are simultaneous events. This design ensures that new blockchains have a built-in liquidity mechanism, facilitating the exchange of assets between chains. Would you like to know more about launching blockchains on Verus?
How do I create a token currency on a system that's not based on Verus?

Actually, with Verus, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. This is possible because Verus enables users to create decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without requiring any programming knowledge.

ed on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
